metadata.title: CVE-2017-17688 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: ** DISPUTED ** The OpenPGP specification allows a Cipher Feedback Mode(CFB) malleability-gadget attack that can indirectly lead to plaintextexfiltration, aka EFAIL. NOTE: third parties report that this is a problemin applications that mishandle the Modification Detection Code (MDC)feature or accept an obsolete packet type, not a problem in the OpenPGPspecification.

criterions.comment: enigmail: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
